greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-1/2) * (eta(q) * eta(q^2) * eta(q^6) / eta(q^3))^2 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of f(-x^4)^4 * f(-x^6)^2 / f(x^2, x^4)^2 = f(-x^4)^4 * f(-x^2, -x^10)^2 / f(-x^12)^2 in powers of x where f() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of q^(-1/2) * sqrt(b(q) / (3 * c(q))) * b(q^2) * c(q^2) in powers of q where b(), c() are cubic AGM theta functions.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (36 t)) = 81 (t/i)^2 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A118272.
mathematica: eta[q_]:= q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[q^(-1/2)* (eta[q]*eta[q^2]*eta[q^6]/eta[q^3])^2, {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n,0,50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 07 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) * eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x^3 + A))^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 22 2015
